sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Podcasts are a fantastic opportunity to get up close with the people who know their craft. In this post, we compiled podcasts that are bound to provide valuable insights into UX and new perspectives on the field. Perfect for a short coffee break or a long commute.
articles.title: UX Podcasts For Designers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: Lightsail provides all the power we need to host our websites, as we are used to from AWS, but making it way easier than ever before. In this article, Leonardo Losoviz explores how to launch a WordPress site in Lightsail in a quick and easy way.
articles.title: How To Host A WordPress Site On Amazon Lightsail

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: The new App Directory architecture has been the main character of the recent Next.js release, which keeps bringing up many questions. In this article, Atila Fassina explores the advantages and pitfalls of this new strategy and reflects on whether you should use it in production now or not.
articles.title: Understanding App Directory Architecture In Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Do you need a little inspiration boost? Well, then our new batch of desktop wallpapers is for you. Designed by artists and designers from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for February 2023.
articles.title: The Magic Of February (2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Throughout a customer journey (particularly in B2B), there will be interactions that are primarily between two people rather than a human and an interface. In this article, Paul Boag explains why you cannot improve the user experience without considering the entirety of the UX journey.
articles.title: How B2B Sales Help Us Understand Our Role As UX Designers Better

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: Developers often feel discouraged from editing SVG markup and experimenting with SVG animations, thinking it’s a significant time investment or they need to use a complex animation library to do so. In this article, Adrian showcases his favorite tricks, which make the process streamlined and fun.
articles.title: Easy SVG Customization And Animation: A Practical Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Renaissance Rachel)
articles.description: In this article, Rachel walks you through various ways that product teams can utilize to build relationships with customers. She will share some tips and tricks from her experience that have helped her nurture customer relationships and build better products.
articles.title: How To Build Strong Customer Relationships For User Research

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Brecht De Ruyte)
articles.description: Managing our colors can truly help people to access our content. In this article, Brecht de Ruyte takes a deep dive into how we can create a high-contrast system while maintaining a balance between designing something accessible and respecting the look and feel of a brand.
articles.title: Creating A High-Contrast Design System With CSS Custom Properties

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Suzanne Scacca)
articles.description: 57% of product professionals say that product research has a positive effect on customer satisfaction. 42% agree that it affects profitability. Imagine how much more successful your product would be if you did research continuously?
articles.title: Better ROI For Your Digital Products: Why Continuous Research Is Key

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How do we design effective reviews and ratings? With a distribution chart, decimal scores, tags, recommendation score and unedited product photos.
articles.title: Product Reviews And Ratings UX: A Designer’s Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Peter Ramsey)
articles.description: Striking the right balance between inspiration and innovation might be hard. Let’s explore how to effectively get inspiration from others without losing that magic spark, including some do’s and don’ts along the way.
articles.title: Copying Designs Doesn’t Work, And Here’s Why

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we ask whether technology is making us redundant; will we all soon be replaced with AI? Vitaly Friedman talks to Tejas Kumar to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 55 With Tejas Kumar: Is Technology Making Us Redundant?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stephanie Eckles)
articles.description: The CSS relational selector :has() offers what was previously impossible without JavaScript. Let’s explore some magical powers that :has brings.
articles.title: Level Up Your CSS Skills With The :has() Selector

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Daniel Yuschick)
articles.description: In this article, Daniel Yuschick demonstrates that building selfish components is the key approach to avoiding different pitfalls on the way to good component design.
articles.title: The Key To Good Component Design Is Selfishness

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Pratik Joglekar)
articles.description: In this article, Pratik Joglekar explores the typical traits of introverts and uses them to make parallels and categorize digital experiences that can stand out without being loud.
articles.title: How To Design Better UX With Introverted Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Get better at your craft and support the people in Ukraine — that’s the idea behind our Figma Auto Layout Masterclass with Christine Vallaure. **We are donating all proceeds** from the online workshop to humanitarian aid in Ukraine. Monday, March 27, 09:00AM – 12:00PM PT / 18:00 – 21:00 CET. Donate and join!
articles.title: Figma Auto Layout Masterclass: An Online Workshop To Support Ukraine 🇺🇦

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: Writing code documentation can be overwhelming when there’s no smooth process in place. Streamlining best practices and setting automation in your favor works a long way toward getting permanently up-to-date content that reflects the important pieces of your codebase.
articles.title: Code Documentation, Streamlined

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eloïse Martin)
articles.description: Largest Contentful Paint (or LCP) is a major web performance KPI which is still a new concept for many web developers since it became a ranking factor just recently. In this article, Eloïse Martin provides an overview of the best practices for the integration and optimization of an LCP image.
articles.title: Optimizing The Image Element LCP

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: Useful front-end tools for CSS and JavaScript developers that were most popular last year and will help you speed up your development workflow. Let’s dive in!
articles.title: Top Front-End Tools Of 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Captioning can be much more than text. Design patterns for better UX of subtitles, captions, video players, transcripts and on-screen text.
articles.title: Designing for Accessibility: Best Practices for Closed Captioning and Subtitles UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Shane Hudson)
articles.description: Recently UXPin has extended its powerful Merge technology by adding npm integration, allowing designers to sync React component libraries without requiring any developer input. This new step aims to improve collaboration between designers and developers.
articles.title: Making Your Collaboration Problems Go Away By Sharing Components

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Burel)
articles.description: This article is Eric Burel’s attempt at making the implementation of authentication less obscure. You’ll learn about tokens, authorization, CORS, credentials, HTTP headers, and such.
articles.title: Understanding Authentication In Websites: A Banking Analogy

articles.author: Gerard Hynes
articles.description: Apache Kafka is an open-source event streaming platform that can transport huge volumes of data at very low latency.  Companies like LinkedIn, Uber, and Netflix use Kafka to process trillions of events and petabtyes of data each day. Kafka was originally developed at LinkedIn [https://engineering.linkedin.com/27/project-kafka-distributed-publish-subscribe-messaging-system-reaches-v06] , to help handle
articles.title: The Apache Kafka Handbook – How to Get Started Using Kafka

articles.author: Joseph Mawa
articles.description: React is a popular front-end framework for building interactive user interfaces. It has helped revolutionize the development of data-intensive front-end applications. React's declarative nature makes building user interfaces intuitive. And reusable React components increase development speed and reduce time to production. To further improve the development experience when building user
articles.title: How to Build a React Admin Panel with Refine

articles.description: When learning JaveScript or any programming language, you'll encounter the keyword or term string. articles.title: What is a String in JS? The JavaScript String Variable Explained

articles.author: Shittu Olumide

articles.title: Python Automation Scripts You Should Know

articles.title: How to Manage Linux Processes

articles.title: Learn Data Structures and Algorithms – Introduction and Learning Resources

articles.author: Kingsley Ubah
articles.description: Having a responsive layout is an important component of user interface (UI) design. articles.title: React Native Tutorial – How to Create a Simple Responsive Layout for Beginners

articles.title: How to Build a Calculator App Using React Native – A Step-by-Step Tutorial

articles.description: Django is a powerful and popular web framework for Python. It is used to build robust and scalable web applications with ease. articles.title: Learn Django by Building a Marketplace

articles.description: You have to start somewhere when learning about computers. We just published a comprehensive video course on the freeCodeCamp.org channel designed to help you develop a solid foundation in computer and technology skills. This course is for anyone who is brand new to working with computers or for those who
